name: Themed "Heroes":The Interactive Novels Multiple Choice Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Like most people, the Haitian had a father. What was his name?
questions.explanation:
Guillame.

	Guillame was a respected man in his village and had the power to make people violently ill. He was killed when his son accidentally negated his powers. The events occur in the 35th issue, "It Takes a Village: Part One".

questions.text: What was the name of the little girl "Dallas" Petrelli killed?
questions.explanation:
Au Co.

	Au Co was a little Vietnamese girl who made vegetation grow at a rapid rate. "Dallas" Petrelli and "Austin" Linderman were part of a team assigned to destroy Au Co. They thought it was a village, but Linderman was horrified to find that it was a little girl. Petrelli killed her anyway. These events happened in the "War Buddies" arc.

She contracts a virus.

	Hana, known as "Wireless", only appeared once in the television series, but featured prominently in the novels. She was sent to destroy a tracking system, and caught a computer virus. Dying, she manually set the system to self-destruct. The events happened in the two-part "The Death of Hana Gitelman".

questions.text: With whom does Hana communicate after her body has died?
questions.explanation:
Micah Sanders.

	Micah and Hana, being especially adept with technology thanks to their powers, communicate even though Hana is technically dead. This event happened at the end of "The Death of Hana Gitelman: Part Two".

questions.text: In the future seen in "Five Years Gone", how do Peter Petrelli and Niki Sanders meet?
questions.correct: He busts her out of prison
options: She sees him at a bar
He sees her at a gentleman's club
They oppose each other in an election
questions.explanation:
He busts her out of prison.

	Peter and Hiro help convicts escape a prison established by Parkman. Peter meets Niki in this way. The events happened in the two-part story "Walls".

questions.text: Noah Bennet visited Eden McCain's father to inform him of her death. How did he react?
questions.explanation:
Indifferent.

	He was of the opinion that Eden never amounted to anything, and thus she was worthless. Eden, who had killed herself rather than let Sylar take her powers, planted suggestions in people's minds. Enraged at the reaction, Bennet told the Haitian to erase the father's memory, but to leave the guilt. The events happened in "Fathers and Daughters".

questions.text: Audrey Hanson chased after Sylar. Who perished in the struggle?
questions.explanation:
An old man.

	Chased by Agent Hanson, Sylar gave his outer layer of clothes to an old, homeless man. Focused on killing Sylar, Hanson fired when she saw someone in Sylar's coat and killed the old man. This happened in "Turning Point".

questions.text: Nathan Petrelli saves a little girl from a fire. What does he leave behind?
questions.correct: His coat with a "Vote Petrelli" pin on it
questions.explanation:
His coat with a "Vote Petrelli" pin on it.

	This event happened in "Nathan", the third online novel. It shows that Nathan isn't completely without morals.

A photograph.

	The photograph of himself, Micah and Niki was taped on his prison wall. Confused about his powers, D.L. wore his knuckles bloody trying to escape prison, but the photo reminded him to focus, at which point he used his phasing abilities to escape prison.

questions.text: When Bennet enters a coffee shop, what does he do?
options: Laces one cup of coffee with strychnine
questions.explanation:
Orders coffee for everyone.

	This event happened in the twenty-third novel, "Family Man". Bennet goes into a coffee shop and orders everyone coffee in the hopes that it will shake off anyone who might be tailing him.
